greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of 2n into the sum of two twin primes.
comment: a(n/2)=0 for the n in A007534. The logarithmic plot of this sequence seems very regular after 200000 terms
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
T. D. Noe, Logarithmic plot of 10^6 terms
formula: a(n) = sum(A164292(2*n - A001097(k)): A001097(k) <= n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 03 2014
mathematica: nn=1000; tw=Select[Prime[Range[PrimePi[nn]]], PrimeQ[ #+2]&]; tw=Union[tw,tw+2]; tc=Table[0,{nn}]; tc[[tw]]=1; Table[cnt=0; k=1; While[tw[[k]]<=n/2, cnt=cnt+tc[[n-tw[[k]]]]; k++ ]; cnt, {n,2,nn,2}]
program: a129363 n = sum $ map (a164292 . (2*n -)) $ takeWhile (<= n) a001097_list
xref: Cf. A175931 (n for which a(n-1), a(n), a(n+1) are equal). [From _Juri-Stepan Gerasimov_, Oct 23 2010]
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Apr 11 2007
ext: Comment converted to crossref by _Klaus Brockhaus_, Oct 27 2010
